collectionDescription: The daily cumulative Gap-filled Fractional Snow Cover (GFSC) product provides pixel-wise snow cover extent as a percentage (0% â€“ 100%) with a spatial resolution of 60 m x 60 m. It is generated on a daily basis at European scale based on synthetic aperture radar (SAR) data from the Sentinel-1 constellation and optical imagery from the Sentinel-2 constellation. The product is generated by merging all available Sentinel-1 and Sentinel-2 observations acquired over the previous seven days to produce a spatially complete composite of snow conditions, thereby reducing data gaps caused by cloud cover and sensor coverage limitations. Snow information derived from Sentinel-1 is focused on the detection of wet snow in high-mountain areas. It is available for the period from 2016 to the present. More information here.

layers.longDescription: Fraction of the surface covered by snow (ranging from 0% to 100%). The dataset has also the following classes: cloud or cloud shadow (205), inland water (210), and no data (255).

layers.shortDescription: Quality layer for the snow fraction (GF) layer
layers.longDescription: Quality layer providing basic assessment of the snow fraction GF layer. For pixels with a QAFLAGS bit 7 value of 0, the data quality refers to the Sentinel-2 optical snow data quality. For pixels with a QAFLAGS bit 7 value of 1, the data quality refers to the Sentinel-1 SAR wet snow data quality.

Bitmask layer with pixel quality flags. The default visualisation displays the sensor type of the satellite data (optical=0, radar=1). These correspond to pixels where bit 7 is activated. Additional information can also be visualised by selecting other bits. More details are available in the </> Custom option.

layers.shortDescription: Sensing start date (seconds from Unix time).
layers.longDescription: Timestamp of the data acquisition date. Expressed as the total number of seconds elapsed since the Unix epoch (01 January 1970, 00:00:00 UTC).
